title: Worked for awhile
comment: After over a month of back and forth with the developer, it finally worked on my stock Sprint S4. I am now running CyanogenMod 12.1 and it refuses to sync my calendars again. Privacy Guard is off but still nothing. I'm forced to switch to something else.

title: Awesome
comment: Now it's even more awesome now it has tasks support.

title: Easy and Open
comment: Seamless integration with the calDAV and cardDAV standard, would love to see Task support. *UPDATED* Task support works great with the Tasks app by Marten Gajda. Thanks for the great support!
Hi Tara, Tasks sync is now supported! Can you test it with your device ;) ? If you need help: play@bitfire.at

title: Works but lacks features
comment: It works, but can't alter the synced calendars!
Please contact play@bitfire.at for information
Reliable, lightweight,  opensource!

title: OK with owncloud
comment: I used it to sync calendar and contact from owncloud server. Thx to devel guys!

title: Not bad but some snags
comment: No 1 gripe: I see this has been fixed,  good stuff,  will try it out: cannot change an account's password.  This is 2015, passwords get expired,  and in spite of it being a paid app,  the developer is not interested in fixing this. Secondly it does not seem to sync changes to existing appointments properly on Oracle Beehive
With DAVdroid/0.7.2, you CAN change your password. Please contact us for assistance: play@bitfire.at

title: Not working properly on Lollipop
comment: Hi,  I have purchased this and installed it in my Xperia Z2 which was running on KitKat. My server is Baikal. It was working flawlessly.  However, things started to act weirdly after I upgraded my phone to Lollipop. Everytime I add a new contact in the phone, the name will always become empty.  After I sync the database, I access the addressbook via my PC and I can see the new entry. It only has the phone number.  I'm not sure is this, lollipop's fault or davdroid's fault. UPDATE #2: More weird things. Some contacts are missing in the phone, but it is available in the baikal database. I verified it by installing CardDAV-Sync free beta by Marten Gajda  and I can find the contact after that. Really weird. I really hope that I don't have to buy another apps after I have purchased this.
this seems to be a very strange behaviour. can you maybe contact us by email, since we cannot have a proper conversation here? email: play@bitfire.at. thank you

title: Just works
comment: One of those apps you are likely to forget are even installed because once configured they just do their job, but an important one for everybody who cares about controlling their personal data. Six stars for developer responsiveness - he helped me work around a badly configured server faster than I could say "bug"!
Reliable & quiet: perfect background sync app

title: Very nice
comment: Pretty simple to use once there are established calendars/contacts on the server. Excellent support by the developer!
Please write us: play@bitfire.at – DAVdroid is now fully compatible with Synology.

title: Often fails to synchronize
comment: ... and doesn't tell me much more than that.
Please contact us: We probably have a solution for your problem: play@bitfire.at

title: Ahogy kell
comment: Teszi a dolgát. Működik Caldav szerverrel (Davical) és az OwnCloud megoldásával is pl.

title: Great App
comment: Great App....Great Dev Response

title: Great app
comment: New update fixes sync error in previous version. Developer is great! Very responsive.

title: Contact Sync Problem [quickly solved]
comment: [EDIT: Great communication with the developers who reacted quickly and solved the issue for me. Indispensable Application!]Unfortunately, the app stopped working. Contact sync is broken for me (in the sync process all contacts appear, but are deleted shortly after)
Great to hear that it works now!

title: Seamless integration
comment: Hello! This app provides hassle-free integration with CardDAV & CalDAV. I am using this on ownCloud 7+ and it is pretty darned easy to setup. Definitely worth considering if you're looking to exit the non standards-compliant Google ecosystem. I would go in more detail, but the other reviews speak for themselves.

title: Oopps guys. Missed a big detail
comment: Every time I add a new calendar, I have to remove the caldav account and re add so to get calendar sync check list to add to the sync?  Sorry guys this app is not scalable. Going back to caldav-sync and carddav-sync. Thx

Do you really think we MISSED this? ;) We know that this feature is not yet implemented in our free & open-source app. Your donation (=your purchase - DAVdroid is available for free, too!) can be refunded if you want. Please contact us via play@bitfire.at in this case. Thank you

title: Can't get a refund
comment: I tested this app but it did not connect to my Zimbra Server. I uninstalled it but I could not get a refund. What it wrong ?
Please contact play@bitfire.at to get a solution or refund.

title: Sehr guter Support
comment: Verwendung mit einem lokalen Raspberry Pi Owncloudserver. Nach dem erstellen eines Server-Zertifikates auf dem Pi und Export des Clientzertifikates auf das Smartphone, sowie der Behebung von Problemen auf dem Nexus 5 mit dem Exchange-Dienst, funktionierte die Syncronisation anstandslos. Anfragen per Email wurden sofort beantwortet.

title: Great for our Owncloud integration
comment: Get away from Exchange! This app works stupidly well with our servers, thanks dev team.

title: Great App for Ditching Google
comment: This app has allowed me to almost completely replace all Google services with my own hosted by ownCloud. My calendar and contacts are now all stored in my ownCloud, under my control, and they all sync seamlessly thanks to this app.

title: Now works perfectly
comment: Get crash on trying to add account. Using owncloud. Have sent crash reports hopefully can fix as I think this would be best client. . Update: now works as I hoped it would when first installed. Great updates.
Thank you for updating your review!

title: Crap app
comment: No possibility of trying before buying, sucks when the app doesn't work. Cannot add owncloud url without getting I/O error.
Crap review - no possilibity of contacting you, not giving a useable bug report sucks. Cannot delete this review although it causes facepalm.

title: Bad application
comment: I'm not able use home server. Do not allow self signed https certificate. Not usable.
Bad review. Works with self-signed certificates!
synct im gegensatz zu "CardDAV" all meine OwnCloud Kontakte. Lediglich das SSL Problem sollte ohne manuelles hinzufügen funktionieren - bei den anderen Apps geht ja auch...

title: Needs more work
comment: Quite an immature product. Would not have bought it if I have known earlier. Does not allow configuration change once it is set up. No option to change sync interval.
We've made big progress and integrated a settings dialoge. If you need help please write: play@bitfire.at. Thank you

title: Great!
comment: Works flawlessly since the last update on galaxy s5 with owncloud installation as backend.. The last update corrected some issues I had with my ssl certificate on my tls vhost.. As said, all great since then..

title: Works brilliantly with Contactzilla
comment: After moving from iOS which has fantastic CardDAV support I was surprised to find it was not baked in to Android. DAVdroid solved this and meant I could access my Contactzilla address books on my Nexus 5 and 7.

title: Great App, friendly support
comment: works great with my Radicale CalDAV server :).

title: jellybean workaround auch auf KitKat nötig
comment: dann bleiben auf dem nexus 5 aber endlich auch die Einstellungen beim update erhalten!

Das Problem (ein Bug von Android/Google Play, NICHT von DAVdroid) ist hier beschrieben: http://davdroid.bitfire.at/faq/entry/account-gone-after-updating. Die Lösung ist den DAVdroid JB-Workaround zu installieren.

title: Wonderful. It just works
comment: No problems far. Well done, thank you

title: It's not there yet
comment: But then, there's no app available that does it all.   Still missing : note and task sync via caldav. And, Editing existing profiles to add calendars.  Anyway, what it does so far, does it right. No hassle and no strange licence verification to unknown proxy's. By any means, a great way to minimise using Google services.
Hello, we've introduced the availibility to sync tasks in v 0.8. If you need personal help: play@bitfire.at

title: Great App
comment: Well impressed with this app as far as calendar sync functionality is concerned - slick , seamless and stable working with my owncloud box  Unfortunately because of a 'bug/feature' in the only android phone I own (HTC one x) -  it is not at all compatible with the contacts side of this software and caused me no end of frustration trying to get it working  At the time of purchase/download this was not mentioned - so beware if the phone you wish to use this with is a HTC one x and your running the std firmware/software - contacts simply will not work - not even 1 way  The team have suggested a way I may be able to get this to work (custom firmware/software) - and is something I am looking into as I had really hoped this software would achieve for me  Had it worked out of the box it would easily get top marks from me  The team have emailed me a couple of times to try and sort out my issue with contacts - so despite it only half working on my phone I have given above half score
Thanks for telling us your story. We have mentioned the HTC firmware problems in the FAQ and app description now.

title: Perfect +++
comment: Awsome app that I use to connect my owncloud. It took me a bit time too configure my startssl certificate and finally have the connection working over ssl (59$ two years for a wildcard), but this was not related to Davdroid. Well worth its price! Now google dont know who i meet, where I go...
Great to hear. Thank you ;)

title: Not the price worth
comment: Birthdays and groups are not synchronized. Almost no configuration options.

This app is f*cking sh1t, there are no useless configuration options. I like cluttered non-standards-compliant apps with 10.000 "features" and none of them working. Also, groups are not synchronized. Oh wait, there's a Github issue where it's discussed that this isn't even possible! But who cares?

title: great app
comment: great appp, works just fine. just two things: 1) after update my accounts were deleted :/ 2) would be nice for it to handle redirects :)
Thanks for your review. For updates about redirection handling, see https://github.com/rfc2822/davdroid/issues/83

title: Works fine on CE edition of kolab 3.1
comment: just point it at the /iRony folder and it does the right thing

title: It just works
comment: This is the only caldav sync app that simply worked. The rest such as caldav-sync, SolCalendar, etc did not.

title: Does exactly what it says
comment: And in a better way than the other applications I tried. Using it with ownCloud on my own server :)

title: Simple and powerful
comment: This simple tool does not offer a common app-interface, but the possibility to add a WebDAV-Account in the settings of Android. This makes it really simple to add a new WebDAV-Account to my phone and synchronize my calendar and contacts. I tried it with Fruux, which worked perfectly out of the box.
